result:
About

- How I began

Contrary to many of my classmates, I began programming by accident. At St. Mary's College High School I did exceptionally well in Math and Physics, so my advisors advised me to pursue a Mechanical, Civil, or Electrical Engineering degree. I chose Mechanical Engineering, since at that time I had no clue about programming.

At the end of my second year in college at San Francisco State University, I took a mandatory course called "Introduction to Computers". That class was the very first time I worked with a programming language. That class was the most enjoyable class I have taken so far, soon after that semester ended I began looking into that major.

I spent the following year debating whether I should finish my Mechanical Engineering degree or start over and pursue Computer Science. Even though I was already half way done with my Mechanical Engineering degree, I chose to pursue Computer Science.
